comment.author: 32162360@N00
comment._content:
Check out the large size image everyone  ...

I wonder what she was?

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia] Not sure but she has some impressively patched sails. The notes for these images say they came in a box marked 'Belmont Park' - Perth perhaps? See new image up: NOTERO? Or likely RONA:
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons

comment.author: 91549360@N03
comment._content:
[http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons][http://www.flickr.com/photos/beachcomberaustralia]  This is the same ship as below ...
Both photographs taken at the same time. The reefing pendants on fore course and lower fore mainsail are identical. Notero was wrecked in 1883 so not it. Rona (Polly Woodside) was built of steel..so not it either..  [http://www.flickr.com/photos/anmm_thecommons/9242588385/]...

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/91549360@N03] Thanks for the info! We love a good mystery ship...
comment.authorname: Australian National Maritime Museum on The Commons
